subject: RE: [junit] Multi-threaded testing w/ Junit?
msgSnippet: Make a class that implements Runnable, start it like this: new Thread(myRunnable).start() I suggest you make some inner class to wrap the actual testing
messageBody:
Make a class that implements Runnable, start it like this:

new Thread(myRunnable).start()

I suggest you make some inner class to wrap the actual testing code...

Mark

-----Original Message-----
From: Jeff Taylor [mailto:jeff@...]
Sent: vrijdag 14 september 2001 0:53
To: junit@yahoogroups.com
Subject: [junit] Multi-threaded testing w/ Junit?


I have a working junit testcase class that I want to turn into more of a
stress test. The goal is to spawn multiple threads - each one running
the test case a fixed number of times (i.e. 100) . This way, we can
simulate multiple clients.

I'm trying to determine the best approach. To implement a class as a
thread - you need to have your class extend Thread. The testcase class,
of course already extends TestCase.

Does anyone have any ideas? Thanks in advance

-Jeff

--
